summary: Between 1999 and 2019, more than 800,000 people have died from drug overdoses in the United States. We found that in recent years, most states have enacted Good Samaritan laws to help reduce overdose deaths and respond to opioid overdoses. These laws protect people from certain criminal penalties if they call 911 to save an overdose victim. We also reviewed 17 studies on the effectiveness...
title: Drug Misuse: Most States Have Good Samaritan Laws and Research Indicates They May Have Positive Effects
